trans-unit.source: To use the eID-Login app, your TYPO3 instance must use TLS!
To use the eID-Login extension, please set up the scheduler tasks as described in the extensions readme!
To use the eID-Login extension, please configure the default email address which is used when no other "from" address is set for a TYPO3-generated email in the TYPO3 settings!
The eID-Login extension offers an alternative way of login for the Website-Users of your TYPO3 sites, using their electronic identity
The German Identity Card ("Personalausweis") for example can then be used to login in a secure manner.
To use the eID-Login for a specific TYPO3 site, some setup in the site must take place:

It needs one free acccessible page without any content but an own template record. This must be configured as 'Rootlevel' and include the static template 'eID-Login SAML Template (eidlogin)' of the eID-Login extension. This page should not be visible in menues.

There must be at least one free accessible page holding the Frontend-Plugin 'eID-Login Link' as content element. This plugin will render a logo, the link to start an eID-Login and a link to the FAQ regarding eID-Login or an logout link. Also messages which may occur when doing an eID-Login are rendered by the plugin as TYPO3 Flash-Messages. Website-Users which may use the plugin must be configured using the 'Record Storage Page' option.

At least one access restricted page holding the Frontend-Plugin 'eID-Login Settings' to render the links which enable the creation and deletion of an eID connection for Website-Users. Messages which occur in the process are rendered there as TYPO3 Flash-Messages. The pugin also provides a checkbox to disable the password based login for the specific Website-User. It will be rendered, if an eID connection exists. Website-Users which may use this plugin must be configured using the 'Record Storage Page' option. The value of the option must match the one of the 'eID-Login Link' plugin mentioned above.
No sites have been found. Please create a site with pages as described above, to configure the eID-Login for this site.
The eID-Login extension enables users to login to TYPO3 sites using an
For the connection of an eID to their user account and the eID based login, users need an
, this means an application like AusweisApp2 or the Open e-Card App.
By using the German eID card (or another eID) and the associated PIN code the eID-Login provides a secure alternative to the login using username and password.
When using the eID-Login extension in it`s default configuration, no personal data from the eID card will be read. Only the
of the eID is being used.
If any other data is being read, the user will be informed about it.
Setup with SkIDentity as Identity Provider
The easiest way to setup the eID-Login extension is by using the
which has been preconfigured for ease of use. For the default setup, which means only using the pseudonym function, no costs incur. The only requirement is the
For the eID-Login any Identity Provider using the SAML protocol for communication with TYPO3 can be used. Beyond that any service providing an eID-Server according to
(also based on SAML) can be used.
The eID-Login extension uses the SAML protocol, to let users login via an external service (Identity Provider) using an eID.
The SAML protocol defines two major and collaborating entities:
An entity which provides any kind of service over the web. In the scope of the eID-Login extension this is your TYPO3 instance, which contains a SAML Service Provider component.

An entity which authenticates the User and returns a corresponding assertion to the Service Provider. In the scope of the eID-Login extension this can be any standard compliant SAML Identity Provider which supports eID-based authentication, for example the
The eID-Login procedure comprises the following steps:
The User initiates the login procedure at the Service Provider.
The Service Provider creates a SAML authentication request (AuthnRequest) and sends it together with the User via redirect to the Identity Provider.
The Identity Provider authenticates the User using her eID via an eID-Client.
The Identity Provider returns the result of the authentication procedure to the Service Provider (Response).
The Service Provider validates the provided response and logs in the User in case of success.
The eID-Login extension offers an alternative way of login for the registered users of TYPO3 site, using their electronic identity (
). For example the German eID can then be used for a secure login.
Setup of the eID-Login extension for a TYPO3 site consists of three steps:
For the usage of the eID-Login extension a service which makes the eID accessible is needed. This service is called
. You can choose to use the preconfigured
At the Identity Provider your TYPO3 site, which serves as
, must be registered. The process of registration depends on the respective Identity Provider. The information needed for registration is provided in step 2.
In order to use a German eID ('Personalausweis') or another eID for the login at the configured TYPO3 site, the eID must be connected to an Website-User account.
Please click on the (?) icon for help regarding the setup or more information.
Select an Identity Provider. It must support the SAML protocol.
Insert the Identity Providers Metadata URL in the respective form field and assign an Entity ID, which must be used for the configuration of the Identity Provider in the next step.
When inserting the Metadata URL, the values in the advanced settings will be updated. Alternatively the advanced settings can be inserted by hand.
Usually the domain of the TYPO3 site is used.
Enforce encryption of SAML assertions (Check only if the selected Identity Provider supports this feature!)
URL of the Identity Provider to which the SAML authentication request will be sent.
Signature Certificate of the Identity Provider
Certificate to validate the signature of the authentication response.
Encryption Certificate of the Identity Provider
Certificate to validate the signature of the authentication response.
the corresponding AuthnRequestExtension XML element must be inserted here.
Now go to the choosen Identity Provider and use the following data to register the Service Provider there:
You have chosen SkIDentity. Click the button to the right, to go to SkIDentity.
The metadata as provided by the Service Provider at the URL
To use the eID-Login, the eID must be connected to the user account. For this you need an eID-Card, like the German eID, a suitable cardreader and an active eID-Client (for example
After establishing the connection the eID-Login can be used on every page where the Frontend-Plugin 'eID-Login Link' is used.

of the TYPO3 site, to connect the user account with you eID. This step is optional and can be done later at any time. Just visit the page where the Frontend-Plugin 'eID-Login Settings' is used as a logged is Website-User.

After finishing the wizard, this page will show a form for direct access to the eID-Login settings of the corresponding TYPO3 site. To use the wizard again, reset the settings of the eID-Login extension for this site.
If the eID-Login is activated, the eID-Login link is shown and users can edit eID connections.
Please Note: Required values in the following form are labeled with a *
EntityID of the Service Provider as configured at the Identity Provider
Assertion Consumer URL is determined by the domain of your Service Provider and cannot be changed. Use this value to configure the Service Provider at the Identity Provider.
Only accept encrypted SAML assertions from the Identity Provider. This must be supported by the Identity Provider.
URL of the Identity Provider to which the SAML authentication request will be sent.
Certificate to validate the signature of the authentication response.
Signature Certificate of the Identity Provider *
Certificate to encrypt the authentication request. Omitting the element means that the SAML requests are not encrypted.
Encryption Certificate of the Identity Provider
the corresponding AuthnRequestExtension XML element must be inserted here.
days. For a regular certificate rollover no action is required. The rollover will be done automatically. But you always have the option to do a manual rollover, if needed.
The currently active certificate ends with:
The newly prepared certificate, which is not yet active, ends with:
In a first step new certificates will be created, which will be in the state

After some time the Identity Provider should have noticed the presence of the new certificates or you must explicitly inform the Identity Provider about them. After this has happened the rollover can be executed.
The activation of the new certificates will happen automatically after some time, but can also be done by clicking the button below.

CAUTION: Only do this step manually, if you have made sure that the prepared certificates have been successfully configured at the Identity Provider or there are other important reasons to change the certificates immediately.
The button is only active if the rollover has been prepared already!
Identity Provider settings could not be fetched
Service Provider metadata could not be fetched
Please confirm that the Service Provider has been registered at the Identity Provider. Pressing the 'Next' button will activate the eID-Login.

Changing the Identity Provider Settings will very likely make existing eID connections of Website Users from the site`s Record Storage Page not work anymore, as they are bound to a specific Identity Provider! You should make a backup of the settings before saving! Please decide, if the existing eID connections of Website Users from the site`s Record Storage Page should be deleted when saving.

Reset of settings will also delete eID connections of the Website Users from the site`s Record Storage Page. After this they will not be able to use the eID-Login anymore and they must create new eID connections! Are you sure?
This will create new certificates which will be propagated in the Service Provider SAML Metadata. Are you sure?
This will replace the already prepared certificates and replace them with a new ones which will be propagated in the Service Provider SAML Metadata. Are you sure?
Certificate Rollover could not be prepared
This will remove the currently used certificates from the Service Provider SAML Metadata and activate the prepared certificates. Are you sure?
Certificate Rollover could not be executed
Encryption Certificate of the Identity Provider has an insufficent public key length. The minimal valid key length is
Encryption Certificate of the Identity Provider could not be read
Signature Certificate of the Identity Provider has an insufficent public key length. The minimal valid key length is
Signature Certificate of the Identity Provider could not be read
Signature Certificate of the Identity Provider is missing
EntityID of the Service Provider is missing
For using the SAML Profile according to BSI TR-03130 an Encryption Certificate of the Identity Provider is needed
For using the SAML Profile according to BSI TR-03130 the encryption of SAML assertions is needed
AuthnRequestExtension XML Element is no valid XML
No valid Single Sign-On URL of the Identity Provider
Identity Provider Single Sign-On URL must start with https
Single Sign-On URL of the Identity Provider is missing
EntityID of the Service Provider is missing
Your account is currently not connected to your eID. Create a connection to use your German eID ('Personalausweis') or another eID for the login. More information can be found in the

Your account is currently connected to your eID. By default you can use Username and Password or eID to login. Activate the following option, to prevent the login by username and password and enhance the security of your account.
Disable password based login. This will be unset if you change the password, i.e. via password recovery.
Password based login is disabled for this account
Password based login cannot be disabled, as no email is defined for the user account
Creation of eID connection failed! Please ensure the used eID-Card is valid.
Login with eID failed! Please ensure the used eID-Card is valid.
The eID is already connected to another account
The eID is not yet connected to an account
